arts.ttl: Serie A | Genoa 1-0 Parma: Match Report
arts.sum: In a crucial encounter between two teams hovering just above the relegation zone, Genoa emerged victorious against Parma, clinching their first home win of the season. The match, which took place at the Stadio Luigi Ferraris, saw both sides grappling with significant injury concerns. The post Serie A | Genoa 1-0 Parma: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Genoa 1-0 Parma: Thorsby and Vieira secure first home victory
arts.sum: A deflected Morten Thorsby effort allowed Genoa to get the better of Parma to secure...

arts.ttl: Serie A | Genoa v Parma: Probable starting lineups
arts.sum: As Genoa prepare to host Parma at the Stadio Ferraris, both teams are grappling with injury concerns while welcoming back key players. The home side faces a significant setback with several players sidelined due to various injuries. The absence of Caleb Ekuban, Brooke Norton-Cuffy, Honest Ahanor, and Ruslan Malinovskyi continues, while Vitinha joins the list with a recent thigh strain. The post Serie A | Genoa v Parma: Probable starting lineups appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Genoa vs Parma: a lunchtime salvation game
arts.sum: After losing only one of their first 12 home matches against Parma in Serie A (W6 D5), Genoa have lost each of their last three, with an overall score of 3-9; in the period (since 2018/19), among the teams that the Rossoblù have faced more than once at the Ferraris stadium in the top-flight, the Ducali are the one that have scored the most goals on average per game (3.0). Among the opponents faced in at least 30 matches in Serie A, only against Torino (seven) have Parma recorded fewer defeats than those registered against Genoa (10).

arts.ttl: Transfer news and rumours today: Romain Esse to Crystal Palace, Woyo Coulibaly to Leicester, Philip Billing to Napoli
arts.sum: Sports Mole rounds up the latest transfer news and rumours, including Romain Esse to Crystal Palace, Woyo Coulibaly to Leicester City and Philip Billing to Napoli.

arts.ttl: Genoa Pursue Southampton’s Sulemana as January Transfer Window Opens
arts.sum: Genoa are looking to strengthen its attacking options during the January transfer window, with Tino Sulemana from Southampton emerging as a primary target. The 22-year-old winger, who has made nine appearances in the Premier League this season, is seen as a valuable addition to the squad. The post Genoa Pursue Southampton’s Sulemana as January Transfer Window Opens appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Genoa v Parma: Match Preview
arts.sum: As the Serie A season progresses, Genoa and Parma find themselves locked in a tight battle for survival, separated by just one point in the standings. This Sunday, they will face off at the Stadio Luigi Ferraris in a match that both teams desperately need to win to kickstart their 2025 campaigns. The post Serie A | Genoa v Parma: Match Preview appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Genoa’s Patrick Vieira Prepares for Crucial Match Against Parma
arts.sum: Genoa head coach Patrick Vieira held a press conference today at the "Gianluca Signorini" training center in Pegli, ahead of the team's upcoming match against Parma. The match, scheduled for Sunday at the Luigi Ferraris Stadium, marks Genoa's first home game of 2025, and Vieira shared insights on the team's preparation and mindset. The post Genoa’s Patrick Vieira Prepares for Crucial Match Against Parma appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Parma Make Positive Strides in Pursuit of Vogliacco
arts.sum: Parma are making significant progress in their efforts to secure Alessandro Vogliacco from Genoa, with recent positive contacts indicating that the operation could soon be finalized. Gianluca Di Marzio reports that the 26-year-old defender is expected to join Parma on a loan deal that includes an option to buy, which aligns with the club's strategy to bolster their squad during the January transfer window. The post Parma Make Positive Strides in Pursuit of Vogliacco appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Weekend acca predictions: Five teams to back across Europe
arts.sum: It is set to be another busy week across the continent with action resuming in the Bundesliga and La Liga after the winter hiatus and Liam Flin has scanned the leagues to assemble a five-team acca for Saturday and Sunday.
